Reviews.Title: Upgraded from Samsung Admire (1X) to Attain(1X&4G), it's amazing!
Reviews.Author: Forrest W. Smith "moviemadnessman"
Reviews.Content: Pros: 4G Coverage, Screen brightness & flow, different android gingerbread theme, back&front; camera, really fast phone with no lag, 7 home screen pages, wallpaper doesn't stretch, lock screen is nice, descent battery life, CAN USE APPS AND INTERNET WHILE ON PHONE CALL. AMAZING.Cons: Gingerbread keyboard not installed..but that's not such a big deal since you can download it from android market. Other than that it's awesome!Summary: So I upgraded from the Admire (2.5G) to the Attain 4G. I was so sick (even in Boston) of Facebook being so slow due to the 1X speeds and boy was it worth it! With the 4G in Massachusetts I seemed to get 1-2 1/2 mbps of speed which is actually nice! I did a lot of research and decided to get the Attain since I like the 3.5" screen size and the phone is so sexy! I just wanted the 4G upgrade I didn't feel the need to get the Connect!!! I have to say 4G speed is amazing, and it has a new theme in the phone since it is 2.3.6. and It's green!!One thing I like is the 4 touchable buttons on the bottom of the phone. I had that with the admire and I love it. Unlike with the Admire when u press them for a sec the phone will go on but the attain you have to hit the power button because the screen won't go on so no butt dialing ever again!I live in a basement apartment where I mostly roamed, but for some reason I get 0-2 (5 max) bars throughout my house without roaming! It's amazing! My ex bf had the esteem and he roamed everywhere like my Admire did in my apartment. Amazing phone couldn't be happier!! Got it from Best Buy for $229 and I am a very happy customer now :) Good job metro!!

Reviews.Title: Serious problem activating these (2)- notified seller still not done.
Reviews.Author: Jeanne B. Green "Craigwatcher"

Sadly-- the two phones were disposed of by recipient (out of frustration) so I can't get a refund ( seller did offer) but I am NEVER going to make a purchase like this again (Used items from unknown seller). I have given up -it is a $260.00 loss to me but I learned a lesson .

Reviews.Title: Last online cell phone purchase.
Reviews.Author: SANDRA BELL
Reviews.Content: Okay, when I had to travel cross town to purchase a sim card and was told the phone was obsolete, i thought no big deal. But to my surprise it kept getting worse,found out that i could not use camera w/o memory card okay fine. had the phone about a week battery is dead. thought i was getting a good deal, but guess not. So again I am looking to purchase a 4g phone but this time i will go to the store so i can see what i am getting. yes i know i will pay a little more, but i feel confident that it will work. I did learn a valuable lesson...will never purchase cell phone online again!!!

Reviews.Title: Great phone!

Reviews.Content: Wonderful phone for android. This was my first android phone and I loved it. sad to say I was truly disappointed with metro pcs. The coverage was not very good to say the least. The $40 unlimited was awesome though! But I was very happy with the phone.

Reviews.Title: No, no, no, no Stay Away
Reviews.Author: noname
Reviews.Content: I had this phone for less than 6 weeks, babied it and then one day it just stopped working.  I tried to take it back and they opened it and said "oops, water damage."  Well it was never near water, I did not carry it on my person so perspiration was not an issue.  I have air conditioning, so humidity was not an issue.  Each place I took it to did the same thing, open the back, pull out the battery and say "water damage, you have to buy a new phone."  Samsung said to go to Metro PCS (don't use them) and Metro PCS consistently told me I'd have to purchase a new phone.  AFTER SIX WEEKS????  No, this is a scam.  Also, as others have said, it is hard to get activated. You also have to watch out when paying your bill online.  The website does not go to a payment center, it is some franchisee or something.  Just be careful.  The reception was fine in the city, but you won't want to travel to the suburbs with it.  I've had ATT and Verizon.  So far, Verizon is the best reception.  However, I have unlimited text, data, phone and they will not honor that if I switch from my blackberry to a 4G phone which this one was.  Also, the speaker phone on this phone is absolutely horrible.

Reviews.Title: Ugh! Battery Life
Reviews.Author: MCMoneypenny
Reviews.Content: I switched over from a virgin mobile triumph to Metro PCS. I think because Virgin was all-in-all such a good deal that MetroPCS  has felt like a buzz-kill. The phone has an anemic battery life and I feel like I virtually have a landline because it ALWAYS needs to be plugged in charging. Charge at home, charge in the car, charge whenever at a computer. The damn thing is always out of juice. It feels like 4 hours is all one can get from a charge. I'll buy the expanded battery off of ebay if I can stand rocking this phone any longer.As for the interface, it works; nothing special. I do like tethering the phone via Wifi Hotspot & Tether through the app store, but ultimately it doesn't seem all that worthwile as the "4g" isn't that much faster (if at all) than Virgin's 3g. This phone would be a good lateral step for someone who was coming off of post-paid, but I have been eyeing the HTC EVO V 4g since I heard about it (which was right after my BB return would have expired :(Metro has ok coverage in Boston, but anywhere outside of the city and poor service can be expected. Poor choice for me, maybe better for someone else. Rhapsody is a decent feature to be included by Metro, but I would just use Tinyshark anyways on another carrier. Bluh!
